info.title: BioGazelle
info.description:
Please generate a token in the user security settings and keep it safe. It's functionally a password, and as such, can't be recovered later.

API requests are throttled to 2 requests every 5 seconds. This limit may be removed by [donating any amount](https://torrents.bio/donate) to help fund the service.

Thank you for supporting [BioTorrents.de](https://torrents.bio), an open platform for libre biology data.

post.description: Search Manticore by any combination of facets
Upload a new torrent to the site

get.description: Get torrent details by various id's
Retrieve the full site ontology, including its content categorization and supported metadata
Read aggregate torrent and tracker economy stats
Read aggregate site visitor stats from Plausible and the database

Example 1.name: dev.torrents.bio
Example 1.description: An open platform for libre biology data

Example 1.title: Psychoactive Mushrooms
Example 1.description:
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a5/Psilocybn.svg/2000px-Psilocybn.svg.png)

Everything related to psilocybin, the molecule that makes mushrooms magic!
Biosynthetic pathways, psilocybe genomics and phylogenetics, chemical analyses of psychoactive mushrooms alkaloids, it's all here.

This collection also showcases data about other psychoactive fungi compounds such as muscimol and ergotamine.

data.name: dev.torrents.bio
data.description: An open platform for libre biology data

1.Name: Sequences
1.Description: For data that's ACGT, ACGU, or amino acid letters on disk

2.Name: Graphs
2.Description: For pathway and regulatory network data, structured taxonomies, etc.

3.Name: Systems
3.Description: For data that examines one facet broadly, not one subject deeply

4.Name: Geometric
4.Description: For structured data (XML, etc.) that describes the subject's orientation in space

5.Name: Scalars/Vectors
5.Description: For data that describes observations over time or space

6.Name: Patterns
6.Description: For data that describes recurring structures in nature such as common pathways or motifs in the proteome or metabolome

7.Name: Constraints
7.Description: For data that records experimental control behavior, checks readings against known physical constants, tracks the thermodynamic limits of reactions, etc.

8.Name: Images
8.Description: For data you can look at!

9.Name: Spatial
9.Description: For data that's limited to specific locations or otherwise describes macroscopic space

10.Name: Models
10.Description: For projections, simulations, and other hypothetical or computer-generated data

11.Name: Documents
11.Description: For documentation, software, disk images, and literature datasets

12.Name: Machine Data
12.Description: For raw reads and machine data of any category

data.title: Psychoactive Mushrooms
data.description:
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a5/Psilocybn.svg/2000px-Psilocybn.svg.png)

Everything related to psilocybin, the molecule that makes mushrooms magic!
Biosynthetic pathways, psilocybe genomics and phylogenetics, chemical analyses of psychoactive mushrooms alkaloids, it's all here.

This collection also showcases data about other psychoactive fungi compounds such as muscimol and ergotamine.
